meanings.definition: A short section of text taken from a longer work.
meanings.sent1: In the article, the author included several paraphs to support their argument.
meanings.sent2: The student highlighted the important paraphs in the textbook.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a mysterious paraph in the old diary.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a beautiful paraph, capturing the essence of the novel.
meanings.sent5: The paraphs in the poem painted a vivid picture of the setting.

meanings.definition: To summarize or restate a text in one's own words.
meanings.sent1: She had to paraphs the paragraph for her assignment.
meanings.sent2: Students often paraphs information to better understand it.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to paraphs the news in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: His ability to paraphs complex ideas impressed his classmates.
meanings.sent5: Paraphsing the article helped her grasp the main points.

meanings.definition: A flourish or ornament in calligraphy.
meanings.sent1: The calligrapher added elegant paraphs to the wedding invitations.
meanings.sent2: The artist's signature style included intricate paraphs.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with edible paraphs for the celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her tattoo featured unique paraphs that held a special meaning.
meanings.sent5: The book cover was adorned with golden paraphs, making it stand out.
